TITLE: U.S. to require negative Covid test for travelers from China as virus spreads
SUMMARY: The new policy comes amid a surge in Covid cases in China and as fears of a new variant emerge

TITLE: Novak Djokovic says there are no hard feelings over deportation as he returns for Australian Open
SUMMARY: Djokovic has won the Australian Open a record nine times, including the last three times he played. Rafael Nadal won the 2022 title in Djokovic’s absence

TITLE: Risk of a dangerous new Covid variant in China is ‘quite low,’ U.S. health expert says
SUMMARY: No new Covid variant has emerged despite perhaps billions of omicron infections worldwide this year, said Dr. Chris Murray of the University of Washington

TITLE: Promising new Covid pill shows key advantages over Paxlovid in trial
SUMMARY: A Chinese antiviral pill was found to be as effective as Paxlovid in a Phase 3 trial, and it appeared to cause fewer side effects

TITLE: Wuhan is once again besieged by Covid — three years after it recorded the world's first cases
SUMMARY: “Everyone has accepted it quite openly,” said one resident of Wuhan, where coronavirus cases have exploded. “People are just desperate to move in a good direction now

TITLE: Flu and RSV on the decline but Covid hospitalizations rise
SUMMARY: Holiday gatherings and travel, however, could send flu activity up again, experts caution

TITLE: What is the XBB.1.5 subvariant? CDC reports a new strain of omicron taking over in the U.S.
SUMMARY: About 40% of confirmed U.S. Covid cases are caused by the XBB.1.5 strain, up from 20% a week ago

TITLE: Hong Kong to resume hamster imports a year after mass cull over Covid
SUMMARY: Officials in the Chinese territory had been criticized over their response to an outbreak of the delta variant that was traced to a pet shop

TITLE: China reopens borders in final farewell to zero-Covid policy
SUMMARY: After three years and months of protest, China unsealed land and sea crossings and ended a requirement for travelers to quarantine on arrival

TITLE: Pentagon drops Covid-19 vaccination mandate for troops
SUMMARY: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin’s memo has been widely expected since legislation to end the mandate was signed into law Dec. 23

TITLE: China's Covid wave threatens another snarl of U.S. medical supply chain
SUMMARY: U.S. efforts to lessen the health care system's reliance on China will be tested in the coming weeks and months as the coronavirus rolls through China

TITLE: Some newly mailed Covid tests from the government expire imminently — even with extensions
SUMMARY: The FDA extended the shelf life of iHealth Covid tests by six months this summer, but many kits still expire in February, and some have already

TITLE: Long Covid symptoms ease for most within a year, new research finds
SUMMARY: Ongoing fatigue, loss of smell, weakness and trouble breathing can be scary and debilitating following Covid. A new study suggests most people do get better

TITLE: Satellite images hint at Covid outbreak's true toll in China
SUMMARY: Social media users have questioned the government’s reporting, pointing to the recent deaths of prominent artists, scientists and academics

TITLE: David Kessler, top health official for Covid vaccines, to leave Biden administration
SUMMARY: Kessler has served as chief science officer in the administration's coronavirus response since January 2021, playing a key role in the rollout of Covid vaccines

TITLE: Could getting Covid raise cholesterol?
SUMMARY: Two recent studies show a link between Covid and higher cholesterol levels in the following year

TITLE: Updated Covid boosters cut the infection risk from XBB.1.5 subvariant by nearly half, CDC finds
SUMMARY: The report provides the first data on how the updated shots fare against the predominant strain in the U.S

TITLE: China says Covid deaths and severe cases have fallen over 70 percent since peak
SUMMARY: A prominent government scientist said 80% of China’s 1.4 billion population had already been infected

TITLE: Sewage from planes is a key Covid tracking tool, reports say, as CDC talks to airlines about wastewater testing
SUMMARY: Analyzing airplane sewage could help scientists track new Covid variants entering the U.S., or identify novel pathogens

TITLE: FDA pulls authorization for AstraZeneca's Covid antibody drug Evusheld
SUMMARY: The drug, meant to prevent Covid in people with weakened immune systems, does not work against the predominant omicron subvariant XBB.1.5

TITLE: Biden plans to end the Covid public health emergency this spring in a major shift to federal response
SUMMARY: The move would have widespread implications for government programs and authorities and mark a new chapter in the federal response to the coronavirus

TITLE: In new oversight role, House Republicans target billions lost to Covid relief fraud
SUMMARY: “Right now, I have no confidence in the federal government’s ability to prevent fraud,” said the House Oversight Committee's new Republican chairman

TITLE: Congress presses Secret Service for more details about state-sponsored foreign hackers stealing Covid relief funds
SUMMARY: At a House Oversight Committee hearing Wednesday, members from both parties cited an NBC News report about a group linked to China's government stealing millions

TITLE: Costs for Covid tests and treatments may rise after federal emergency declarations end in May
SUMMARY: The White House has announced an expiration date for the national and public health emergencies tied to the coronavirus, which have been in place since early 2020

TITLE: Billions stolen in Covid-related fraud, according to estimates
SUMMARY: Three years after the start of the pandemic, the size and scale of Covid-related fraud is staggering. NBC News’ Tom Costello has more details on who may be to blame for the estimated $560 billion stolen in federal relief funds

TITLE: House Republicans take their first swat at Biden’s Covid response
SUMMARY: The hearing is expected to be the first of many by House Republicans around the pandemic response as well as the origins of the Covid virus

TITLE: No new variants emerged from China’s Covid outbreak, study finds
SUMMARY: A genomic analysis found that all infections in Beijing belonged to existing Covid variants, according to a Chinese-funded study published in The Lancet

TITLE: Republicans launch Covid origins probe by requesting info from Fauci and Biden officials
SUMMARY: The panel sent letters to Dr. Anthony Fauci, senior officials like National Intelligence Director Avril Haines and the president of a nonprofit group focused on emerging infectious diseases

TITLE: Immunity from a Covid infection is as protective as vaccination against severe illness and death, study finds
SUMMARY: The immunity generated from an infection was found to be “at least as high, if not higher” than that provided by two doses of an mRNA vaccine

TITLE: Nasal Covid vaccine shows promise in early clinical trial
SUMMARY: Nasal vaccines could provide better protection against infection by bolstering immunity right where the virus enters the body, but few have made it to human trials in the U.S

TITLE: Here's how Covid damages the heart
SUMMARY: Scientists who studied human hearts found that infection appeared to make it harder for them to beat properly

TITLE: Covid-19 ‘likely’ stemmed from accidental lab leak in China, according to DOE
SUMMARY: The Department of Energy says it is “likely” that Covid-19 stemmed from an accidental laboratory leak in China, according to two sources with direct knowledge. The judgment comes with “low confidence,” meaning its credibility is questionable. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports

TITLE: China must be 'more honest' on Covid origins, U.S. ambassador says
SUMMARY: Nicholas Burns’ remarks were criticized by Beijing, which says suggestions that Covid-19 began with a lab leak are politicizing the issue

TITLE: Savannah Guthrie tests positive for Covid during live 'TODAY' broadcast
SUMMARY: The "TODAY" co-anchor did not continue on the show Tuesday

TITLE: FBI director accuses China of trying to 'thwart and obfuscate' Covid origin probe
SUMMARY: "The FBI has for quite some time now assessed that the origins of the pandemic were most likely a potential lab incident in Wuhan,” Wray said Tuesday

TITLE: On its first day free of masks, Hong Kong is in no rush to take them off
SUMMARY: Masks are no longer required indoors or out in the Chinese territory, but residents used to wearing them everywhere for years may find it a difficult habit to break

TITLE: 'Band-Aid over a bullet wound': Should schools use Covid aid to fix crumbling facilities?
SUMMARY: Georgetown University experts say a quarter of the $184 billion in pandemic aid designated for schools since 2020 and spent so far has gone toward facilities and construction

TITLE: Long Covid patients face big medical bills and denied insurance claims
SUMMARY: Millions in the U.S. are out of work because of severe long Covid symptoms, and many are struggling to pay their medical bills. Here's how to navigate insurance coverage

TITLE: U.S. plans to lift Covid testing requirements for travelers from China
SUMMARY: Since early January, the U.S. has required a pre-departure negative Covid test for anyone flying in from China

TITLE: What's your current risk of getting long Covid?
SUMMARY: Seven researchers investigating the prevalence of long Covid in the U.S. said the current risk for vaccinated people is probably 10% or less

TITLE: House passes measure to declassify intelligence on Covid's origins
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday said he hadn't decided whether he'll sign the bill into law

TITLE: For some long Covid patients, acupuncture and other Eastern remedies bring relief that Western medicines have not
SUMMARY: Many people with long-term Covid symptoms say they've improved with acupuncture, meditation and ancient herbs

TITLE: Masks stay put in Japan even as 3-year request to wear them ends
SUMMARY: Dropping the mask-wearing request is one of the last steps Japan’s government is taking to ease Covid-19 rules in public places as it tries to expand business and other activity

TITLE: China to fully reopen borders to foreigners, but near-term hurdles remain
SUMMARY: Western democracies’ unfavorable views of China have intensified because of human rights concerns, aggressive foreign policy and Covid-19 handling, according to a global survey

TITLE: California care home charged in connection with Covid deaths
SUMMARY: Silverado Senior Living Management failed to follow appropriate safety procedures when it admitted a new resident to a Los Angeles facility in March 2020, a criminal complaint alleges. A Covid outbreak followed, resulting in 14 deaths

TITLE: New Covid origins data suggests pandemic linked to raccoon dogs at Wuhan market
SUMMARY: The samples were collected from surfaces at the Huanan seafood market in Wuhan after the first human cases of Covid-19 were found in late 2019

TITLE: Raccoon dogs linked to Covid-19 origins, new data suggests
SUMMARY: According to the Atlantic magazine, a team of scientists says their new analysis of samples taken at a Wuhan market in the early days of the pandemic indicate that infected animals were there including raccoon dogs. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk has more details on the potential origins of Covid-19.&nbsp

TITLE: Biden signs bill on Covid origins declassification
SUMMARY: No senators or House members voted against the legislation

TITLE: Former Florida GOP legislator pleads guilty to Covid relief fraud charges
SUMMARY: Joseph Harding, who sponsored what critics called the "Don’t Say Gay" bill, pleaded guilty to wire fraud, money laundering, making false statements and other crimes

TITLE: Moderna CEO grilled over plan to raise Covid vaccine price at Senate hearing
SUMMARY: Stéphane Bancel argued a price increase was necessary because of waning demand and supply chain issues

TITLE: Court blocks Covid vaccine mandate for U.S. government workers
SUMMARY: The appeals court rejected arguments that Biden, as the nation’s chief executive, has the same authority as the CEO of a private corporation to require employees be vaccinated

TITLE: Biden won't veto GOP measure terminating the Covid national emergency
SUMMARY: The White House announced its opposition to the measure in January, but the administration had already planned to roll back the national emergency in May

TITLE: People with smell disorders may get relief with an experimental treatment
SUMMARY: Is it 'voodoo' or does a procedure called a stellate ganglion block help patients with long Covid-related loss of smell or taste

TITLE: Long-Covid patients find hope in treatment aiming to restore taste and smell
SUMMARY: Doctors at the Cleveland Clinic are trying a procedure to help patients with long-term Covid symptoms, specifically loss of taste and smell, that includes numbing a nerve bundle in the neck. While more studies need to be done, the procedure appears to help restore taste and smell in about 50 percent of patients. NBC News’ Kristen Dahlgren shares more on the research

TITLE: Covid caused brain damage in 2 babies infected during pregnancy, study shows
SUMMARY: The newborns had seizures from the first day of life, and both had severe developmental delays. One infant died at 13 months, and the other was in hospice care

TITLE: Nurse speaks out after being subject of anti-vaccine conspiracy theory
SUMMARY: Tiffany Dover received the Covid vaccine and fainted when she stood to answer questions at an event. That moment spawned an anti-vaccine conspiracy theory that she died and a body double replaced her. She spoke out for the first time to NBC News’ Brandy Zadrozny about her story

TITLE: Biden terminates Covid national emergency
SUMMARY: The White House says President Biden signed a bill to end the national emergency declared during the Covid-19 pandemic that has been in place for more than three years. NBC’s Monica Alba has the details.&nbsp

TITLE: Biden signs bill ending Covid national emergency
SUMMARY: The measure ends the national emergency a month earlier than the Biden administration had planned, prompting changes to some pandemic-related federal programs

TITLE: CDC signs off on 2nd dose of omicron Covid boosters for older adults
SUMMARY: People 65 and up can get another dose of an updated Covid vaccine at least four months after their first updated boosters

TITLE: Millions expected to lose dental care coverage after Medicaid review
SUMMARY: About 14 million people, or 28% of adults currently enrolled in Medicaid, will lose their dental health coverage now that the Covid public health emergency has ended

TITLE: New theories of possible link between Covid vaccines and tinnitus are emerging
SUMMARY: People who have developed life-altering ringing in their ears after Covid vaccinations demand deeper investigation into this potential side effect

TITLE: What to know about XBB.1.16, the 'Arcturus' variant
SUMMARY: The subvariant accounts for nearly 10% of new Covid cases in the U.S

TITLE: Covid vaccination requirement to end next week for federal employees and international travelers
SUMMARY: The administration had said it would end a public health emergency tied to the pandemic on May 11

TITLE: Brazilian police raid Bolsonaro's home as part of Covid vaccine data investigation
SUMMARY: The raid was part of a probe into a group suspected of adding false vaccine data to the government’s Covid database while Bolsonaro was president

TITLE: WHO declares end to Covid global health emergency
SUMMARY: The World Health Organization first issued the emergency declaration in January 2020

TITLE: CDC's Covid tracking changes come as '99 percent plus' of the U.S. is at low levels
SUMMARY: As the global public health emergency comes to a close, the agency will focus on wastewater samples, hospitalized patients and Covid-related deaths

TITLE: Your costs for Covid tests and treatments may rise after the public health emergency ends
SUMMARY: The federal Covid public health emergency ends Thursday. After that, many people may incur new expenses for tests

TITLE: 12 of the most common long Covid symptoms identified in long-awaited new report
SUMMARY: The new research is meant to help scientists move forward in finding a treatment for a condition that still plagues millions of Americans

TITLE: China faces a new Covid wave that could peak at 65 million cases a week
SUMMARY: The country once had some of the harshest Covid restrictions on the planet, but the response from the government and the public is relatively muted this time

TITLE: White House Covid response coordinator Ashish Jha to step down
SUMMARY: Jha’s departure is the latest example of the Biden administration's putting the pandemic in the rearview mirror

TITLE: When should you come out of Covid isolation? Experts weigh in.
SUMMARY: The CDC says we should isolate for five days after testing positive. Other public health officials disagree. Who is right

TITLE: FDA advisers to discuss next round of Covid boosters for the fall
SUMMARY: FDA scientists said in briefing documents the next iteration of the boosters should target an XBB strain

TITLE: Biden picks North Carolina's former health chief, Mandy Cohen, to run CDC
SUMMARY: Cohen, the former secretary of the state's Department of Health and Human Services, will replace infectious disease expert Rochelle Walensky, who's stepping down June 30

TITLE: FDA asks drugmakers to update Covid boosters to target XBB.1.5 for the fall
SUMMARY: The updated shots are expected to be distributed as early as September as part of a fall booster campaign

TITLE: U.S. intelligence community remains divided over likely Covid origin, report shows
SUMMARY: The report's release was required by the Covid–19 Origin Act of 2023, which was passed unanimously by both chambers of Congress and signed into law by President Joe Biden

TITLE: Fraudsters may have stolen $200 billion in federal Covid relief funds, new report says
SUMMARY: The new estimate from the Small Business Administration's watchdog would be nearly one-fifth of all the money disbursed in two federal aid programs from 2020 to 2022
